document.masterDocTitle: Holomorphology and neotype designation of Microperla retroloba (Wu, 1937)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type information.
Holotype : male, China , S. E. Kansu (= southeast of Gansu Province ), Cheumen (= Shimen Town , Longnan City ),
6 May 1919
, Rev. E. Licent , originally deposited in Musée Hoang ho Pai ho of Tientsin (= Tianjin Natural History Museum) but lost according to Wu (1962)
.
Paratype : one female , same locality and data as holotype (lost according to Wu 1962 )
.

Material examined.
Neotype : male, China , Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region , Guyuan City , Liupan Mountain ( Figs. 1 , 2 ), 35.3641 N , 106.3115 E ,
2000 m
,
24 May 2021
, leg. Si-Kai Du (ICJUST)
.
Paratypes : 39 males , 13 females , 17 larvae , 38 exuviae, same locality and data as neotype (ICJUST)
.

caption.paragraph: FIGURE 1. Geographical locations of Liupan Mountain in Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region and Cheumen (= Shimen Town) in Gansu Province.

FIGURE 2.
Microperla retroloba ( Wu, 1937 )
. A. habitat stream in Liupan Mountain; B. fresh exuviae on stones resulting from a massive emergence.

FIGURE 3.
Microperla retroloba ( Wu, 1937 )
. Male habitus, dorsal view.

FIGURE 4.
Microperla retroloba ( Wu, 1937 )
. A. male terminalia, dorsal view; B. male terminalia, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Egg. Disc shaped, typical for Peltoperlidae ( Fig. 11 ), diameter approximately 0.2 mm (N = 2). Irregular follicle cell impressions present on entire chorionic surface; dorsal aspect with a circular depression, the cells in which obscure ( Fig. 11A, C ). Impressions on circular lid conspicuous ( Fig. 11B, D ).
